WORK DURATION: 8 or 12 MONTHS (An 8 month employment period is registered as 2 separate, consecutive work terms, and a 12 month employment period is registered as 3 separate, consecutive work terms). Please state CLEARLY in your cover letter whether you are available for 8 and/or 12 months.

Note For Engineering Undergraduate Students: Before applying to this posting, it is your responsibility to have completed the appropriate pre-requisite courses for this length of work term, and to understand how this length of work term affects your academics. If this means you will be registered in a 5th or higher work term, the full co-op tuition fee (equal to two installments) will be charged for each additional work term above the mandatory four.

NEED HELP TO RELOCATE?
If you're traveling outside Victoria for a co-op work term, you may be eligible for a limited $1,000 travel stipend through the Strategic Framework Experiential Learning Fund (SF-ELF). For details, see the section "Co-operative Education Travel Awards for Work Terms outside Victoria".

At Motorola Solutions we are helping solve some of the biggest challenges around safety and physical security by developing advanced artificial intelligence (AI) technologies and products that are used to help keep people, businesses, and cities around the world safer. Avigilon, a Motorola Solutions company, designs, develops, and manufactures advanced AI, video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions that help change the way people interact with their security systems.

At Motorola Solutions, our co-ops don't wash cars or do coffee runs. They also don't work on side projects. Our co-ops are treated like embedded members on our agile teams and are given the opportunity to learn what being a tester is like in the real world. You'll have the opportunity to learn new technologies and best practices in coding, testing and automation. You'll learn about agile development and what it takes to release an industry leading solution that comprises of hardware, firmware, and software all produced in Vancouver. You'll also have a lot of fun and make a lot of friends.

We are looking for the best people: smart, creative, passionate about their work, and excited for new challenges.

Responsibilities include:

Assist with development and maintenance of an automated build system
Assist with development and maintenance of an automated test framework
Implement programs and scripts that allow automated functional testing of the devices under test (cameras)
Execute test plans and identify and document any issues discovered during testing
Collaborate closely with firmware developers to reproduce and resolve any issues uncovered in the tests
Interact regularly with our Quality Assurance team and ensure correct testing steps are followed
Establish a deep understanding of all firmware components and their interactions

Qualifications:

Proficient with Python or another scripting language
Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting capability
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Good understanding of networking protocols (HTTP, TCP, UDP, IP)
Experience with test management and issue tracking tools
Experience with debugging tools and version control systems
Experience with embedded systems
Experience with development in a Linux environment
Experience with C++, Make and bash
Knowledge of digital imaging/photography and audio/video coding

EEO Statement Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Motorola Solutions will provide reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities upon request.
